result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter J Klismith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Entire sentence can be served on GPS Home Detention Electronic Monitoring. 
Huber for employment and any counseling.

miscConds.notes:
Pay fine of $500 plus costs. 
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Peter J Klismith in court with attorney Robert J. Sisson. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:25 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

State files Amended Information.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.  Restitution has been paid in full up front. 
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - NO CONTEST
Count 3 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Counts 1 & 3.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 2 is dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Sisson makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
Imposed and Stayed - 180 days jail
Entire sentence can be served on GPS Home Detention Electronic Monitoring.
Huber for employment and any counseling. 
Placed on probation for a period of 6 months: 
Pay fine of $500 plus costs.  There is no DNA surcharge as this proceeds January 2014. 

Count 3 - 
Imposed and Stayed 90 days jail, concurrent with Count 1. 
Entire sentence can be served on GPS Home Detention Electronic Monitoring.
Huber for employment and any counseling. 
Placed on probation for 6 months: 
Pay costs.  
Engage in any other counseling that may be deemed appropriate by the agent. 

Court notes restitution of $18,230.18 has been fully paid.

Pre-trial conference on May 18, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on February 23, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Peter J Klismith in court with attorney Robert J. Sisson. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:24 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

Atty Sisson makes statements to the Court.  
Atty Cousins concurs.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on January 26, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Peter J Klismith in court with attorney Robert J. Sisson. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.  

Atty Constable recommends a $10,000 signature bond.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 26, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
